newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: New nickel projects to total 200,000 tonnes - INSG.
newsitem.headline: New nickel projects to total 200,000 tonnes - INSG.

text.p: Confirmed new nickel projects around the world in the next five years are estimated to total some 200,000 tonnes of finished metal, the International Nickel Study Group said on Thursday.
The figure updated an estimate issued last year that did not include the massive Voisey Bay project in Canada.
Voisey Bay had now been incorporated into the statistics, but additional projects not yet fully confirmed continued to be excluded.

The latest estimate was taken from the INSG's Annual Survey of Nickel Industry Developments and was contained in a brief statement issued by the group after a two-day closed-door meeting in The Hague.
The INSG said a wide range of issues concerning nickel statistics was discussed.
The talks recognised gaps in the detailed figures on trade and production of ferronickel. Additional data would be given by members to the group, it said.
"The importance of such data has increased owing to threats to the quality of import data, notably among members of the European Union," the statement said.
The group also revised its full-year 1996 supply and demand totals, saying consumption reached 927,000 tonnes
Stocks held by the London Metal Exchange and nickel producers declined by 5,000 tonnes in the year, it said, adding complete data on stocks held elsewhere were not yet available.
The INSG, which groups industry advisers from around the world, will hold its next meeting in The Hague on October 16-17.
